item.title: Hundreds Dead After 6.0-Magnitude Earthquake Hits Afghanistan
item.description: The quake, near the border with Pakistan, injured more than 1,200 people, the authorities said. The death toll was expected to rise.

item.title: Putin and Modi Hold Hands as They Greet Xi
item.description: The leaders of Russia, China and India shared a moment of bonhomie at a security summit in eastern China on Monday.

item.title: Kyiv Links Moscow to Killing of Former Ukrainian Parliament Speaker
item.description: Ukraine said it had arrested a suspect in the murder of the politician, who had voiced anti-Russian views. The authorities did not explain how the sus...

item.title: A Jamaican Man Served Time in the U.S., Then Was Deported to an African Prison
item.description: The case of Orville Etoria highlights a tension in President Trump’s deportation agenda, in which immigrants can be sent abroad and detained indefinit...

item.title: Israel’s New Negotiating Stance Is Likely to Prolong Gaza War, Experts Say
item.description: A shift toward pressing for a permanent cease-fire deal, alongside plans for a new offensive in Gaza City, means the fighting is unlikely to end soon.
